Received: from Rudra656@... by imo-r16.mx.aol.com (mail_out_v30.10.) id r.dd.14ca723c (9666) for <nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com>; Sun, 20 May 2001 15:16:25 -0400 (EDT)
Message-ID: <dd.14ca723c.28397208@...>
Date: Sun, 20 May 2001 15:16:24 EDT
Subject: Re: Chivtron
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type:  text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding:  7bit
X-Mailer: AOL 5.0 for Windows sub 138
From: Rudra656@...

::Obfucious::
    "Don't be foolish boy.  The shields were repaired before you ever began 
work on them.  You were assigned to work on the weapons which, I might add, 
you never did.  As for my codes not working, I copied your program with only 
one addition.  I made only three codes with the new addition because it is 
for those who were here before I arrived.  And yes I made myself a code, I 
left out the new addition however.  This addition provides for an override in 
case of a lockdown of the ship.  This way only those with the code may travel 
freely during a lockdown and they may begin or end a shutdown."  He begins to 
think to himself about the currant situation.  "Your engineering skills are 
impressive and your ego is enormous."  He turns to the computer and with a 
few quick strokes erases the new program with no way to retrieve it except 
for the copy in his own memory.  "You are obviously more useful here."  He 
manages to get that out with only the slightest hint of sarcasm in his voice. 
 "I'm sure I can find another computer to fiddle with, in a quieter place so 
that I can think at the same time."  He stalks off to a storage locker to 
pick up a few things.
